means: 迎风的（地），上风的（地），向风的（地）

sentence.Network_en: the windward side of the boat
They heeled the sloop well over, skimming it along to windward.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们使单桅小船倾斜适当, 让它顶着风向前滑去.

sentence.Network_en: They erected a 2 - metre - high mud wall on the windward side.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们在迎风的一边筑起了一堵两米高的土墙.

jx.jx_en_mean: (dated)in an advantageous position in relation to

lj.lj_ly: I happen to have &B{got to windward of} the young woman.
lj.lj_ls: 我碰巧占了那位年轻女子的上风。

jx.jx_en_mean: Into or to an advantageous posture or position.

entry.tran: (尤指船侧)迎风的，向风的，顶风的
entry.def: Windward is used to describe the side of something, especially a ship, which is facing the wind.

example.tran: 上层后甲板区的迎风面

example.ex: Gardens on the windward side of a hill receive more rain than those on the lee side.
example.tran: 山坡向风面的花园比背风面的雨水多。

entry.def: If a ship sails to windward, it sails towards the place from which the wind is blowing.

means.word_mean: 1. the direction from which the wind is coming
1. on the side exposed to the wind;
